Allow a Buyer to Email the Contents of the Shopping Cart Page

Support a buyer whose workflow includes sending a copy of their shopping cart contents through email. You can allow a guest or registered buyer to easily generate an email from the Shopping Cart page, with the contents included in an attached PDF. You can customize some elements of the PDF, including text labels and logo.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create CC Page Label records:	Create on CC Page Labels
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

An Email Cart link appears among the options on the Shopping Cart page:

When a buyer clicks the link, the Email Cart window opens, where a buyer can enter a send-to address, CC address, subject, and description.

In the PDF that the recipients receive, you can configure the following options:

Storefront logo shown in the PDF header (1)
Label and URL that links to the cart contents on the storefront (2)
Label that indicates which storefront buyer emailed the PDF (3)
Label that indicates the date the PDF was emailed (4)
WARNING When you enable Cart Scale in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13), the Scaled Cart page replaces the Shopping Cart page version 2.0. The configurations described in this topic can still show the Email Cart button and window on the Scaled Cart page. However, the Scaled Cart page doesn't support sending or rendering the PDF for a cart that contains a large number of items. To avoid potential issues, we recommend that you disable these configurations when you use Cart Scale.

To configure options for the cart email:

Specify whether the Email Cart link is available for a guest or registered buyer.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Cart (3).
To allow a registered buyer to send the email, find the Email Authenticated configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Cart
Configuration	Email Authenticated
Page	all
Value	TRUE
To allow a guest buyer to send the email, find the Email Anonymous configuration (6), and make sure that its value is TRUE (7).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Cart
Configuration	Email Anonymous
Page	all
Value	TRUE

To disallow a guest buyer from emailing the cart contents, set this configuration to FALSE.

Specify the image source for the storefront logo shown in the PDF header.
From the Module picklist, select Header (8).
Find the Logo configuration (9).
Click Override (10) in the Action column.
In the New Page Setting window, enter the path for the image file you want to use for Value, and click Create. This value is the relative path from your theme's static resource to the image file. For example, to reference a file named cart_email_header.png in the images directory of your theme's static resource, enter images/cart_email_header.png.
Specify the URL that the cart link in the PDF navigates to.
NOTE
This step is required so that you update the default placeholder URL with a functioning URL to your storefront. If you skip this step, the URL in the PDF doesn't resolve correctly.
To open the link to the cart from the PDF, the buyer who receives the email must also have access to the storefront and the cart. Otherwise, they’re redirected to an error page.
On the CC Page Labels tab in your org, find the record named CartOrderEmailer_URL, and click Edit.
For ValueRT, replace the placeholder value, https://storeurlgoeshere/prefix/Cart?{0}, with a URL that specifies your storefront's correct domain and URL path, such as https://www.exampledomain.com/DefaultStore/ccrz__Cart?{0}.
Specify a Storefront.
Save your changes.
Optionally, update other page labels that specify text in the PDF.
On the CC Page Labels tab in your org, find the record you want to update, and click Edit:
CartOrderEmailer_Date
Label that indicates the date the PDF was emailed,
CartOrderEmailer_GeneratedBy
Label that indicates which storefront buyer emailed the PDF.
CartOrderEmailer_GoToThisCart
Label for the cart link in the PDF.
For Page Name, keep cc_CartEmail.
Specify a Storefront.
For ValueRT, enter the text that you want to show in the PDF.
Save your changes.
Repeat these steps for other labels.
TIP If you localize your storefront, also create a localized page label record.
If you've enabled page label caching, refresh the cache after you modify page label records to show your updates on the storefront.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
